content.description: Start with hands on the crimp rail. Move up to the top and an easy top out through a couple crimps and fun feet. It's very short but fun while it lasts. (Right Arete is off)
content.location: Far right side of the Sardonic Boulder

content.description: Start on the arete just to the right of Sardonic Right.  Gain the lip of the boulder and traverse left on slopers.  Top out on Sardonic Left.
content.location: Start on the right hand end of the Sardonic Boulder, end on the left hand side.

content.description: SDS with left hand in the sharp crack in the rectangular opening and right hand in the slot. Head up on thin crimps. There are a variety of possibilities for hands and feet that are all equally difficult. Top out by the sloping runnel.
content.protection: A couple pads. There are some jagged rocks right at the base.
content.location: Far left side of the Sardonic Boulder.

content.description: Sit start at hamburger jug and whatever feet you can find. Easy holds to top of short route. Do it for the cuties.
content.location: On nose of boulder immediately right of Sardonic Boulder.

content.description: SDS. Make a couple moves up on crimps to an easy top out. Use anything on the face. Left Arete off.
content.location: Face of the Boulder immediately to the right of Sardonic Main.

content.description: Fun, juggy flake climbing. The topout is the hardest part. Find a couple thin crimps and pull over. The boulder would get a higher rating if it was a bit taller.
content.location: Find the obvious jugs and flake in the center of the boulder. Sit start and climb straight up.

content.description: Hard and long pull off of the start. Delicate feet guard the finish. Good jug up and right for top out.
content.location: Find a jug underneath the overhang and a right hand sidepull down low. Head straight up to the right of the swooping feature.

content.description: This area is secluded and doesn't see much traffic from climbers. You will see hikers?/walkers roaming through the area on faint, unmarked trails. This boulder is relatively short as most problems are under 10 feet high. The rock is okay and the boulder is mostly vertical to slightly overhanging.
